alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:29AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL PREBLE AND NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 415 AM EDT... At 329 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Eaton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Trotwood, Englewood, Eaton, Camden, Lewisburg, West Alexandria, Clayton, Union, Brookville, New Lebanon, Farmersville, Phillipsburg, Oklahoma, West Florence, Fort Mckinley, Wheatville, Interstate 70 at US Route 127, Muttonville and Lake Lakengren. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
